Create a control list for a model

Source: R/prepare_models.R
model_control.Rd

Provides a ready-to-use template for the controls list used to define the specific arguments for a user's novel model, setting the formal arguments to the basic default values.

model_control(
  name = "model",
  data_sets = prefab_data_sets(interpolate = FALSE),
  covariatesTF = FALSE,
  lag = NA,
  arg_checks = TRUE
)

Arguments

name

character value of the name of the model.
data_sets

character vector of the rodent data set names that the model is applied to. Defaults to all non-interpolated data sets.
covariatesTF

logical indicator for if the model requires covariates.
lag

integer (or integer numeric) lag time used for the covariates or NULL if covariatesTF is FALSE.
arg_checks

logical value of if the arguments should be checked using standard protocols via check_args. The default (arg_checks = TRUE) ensures that all inputs are formatted correctly and provides directed error messages if not.

Value

Named list of model's script-generating controls, for input as part of controls_m in write_model.

Contents

Developed by Juniper L. Simonis, Glenda M. Yenni, Ellen K. Bledsoe, Erica M. Christensen, Hao Ye, Ethan P. White, S.K. Morgan Ernest.
